title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 20 January 2015 - XWiki
content:

10:03 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:04 <gsmeria> has left #xwiki  
10:04 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:07 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
10:08 <gsmeria> has left #xwiki  
10:11 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
10:13 <vmassol> good morning  
10:13 <vmassol> guys, what's your status for the 6.4 release, we need to release ASAP  
10:13 <vmassol> (note that I won't be able to perform any release tomorrow since I'm in meetings the whole day)  
10:13 <vmassol> (in addition I'm also in meeting this afternoon)  
10:14 <vmassol> tmortagne: could you take the lead on http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-11443 and send a proposa/vote so that we progress on it?  
10:14 <vmassol> seems Denis created a new issue too http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-11678  
10:15 <vmassol> we need to decide if it's blocker for 6.4 final or if it can wait 6.4.1  
10:15 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: could you please check it out?  
10:16 <gdelhumeau> close  
10:17 <vmassol> close?  
10:18 <vmassol> you just closed it  
10:18 <vmassol> so you mean closed! :)  
10:18 <vmassol> \*meant  
10:18 <vmassol> cool  
10:18 <vmassol> one less  
10:18 <gdelhumeau> yep sorry  
10:19 <vmassol> (I understood "close" as in "you should close it" )  
10:19 <tmortagne> ok sending a mail for http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-11443 but frankly I don't have a stron opinion on this, it's not like I was doing much wiki skins  
10:19 <vmassol> tmortagne: you're the one with the strongest opinion so far :)  
10:19 <vmassol> (from what you discussed with me)  
10:19 <Denis> Just for the reference, I do not see how "Variables categories disappear when we navigate through them" could look related to even the color theme !  
10:19 <tmortagne> no i'm the one with the technical explanations that's all  
10:19 <vmassol> (and you're free ATM for 6.4)  
10:20 <vmassol> ok so 3 issues remaining for 6.4: http://jira.xwiki.org/issues/?filter=13410&jql=category%20in%20(%22Top%20Level%20Projects%22)%20AND%20fixVersion%20in%20(%226.4%22)%20AND%20resolution%20in%20(Unresolved)  
10:20 <vmassol> if we exclude the baseskin issue that means 2  
10:20 <vmassol> 2 for marius  
10:20 <vmassol> mflorea: what's your ETA for those?  
10:21 <vmassol> lots of failing tests at http://ci.xwiki.org/ though  
10:21 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:21 <vmassol> could everyone have a look to help fix them?  
10:21 <vmassol> as I said yesterday 3 are for extensions  
10:23 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: XWIKI-11041 has lots of associated commits but it's still open  
10:23 <mflorea> vmassol: I still need 1-2 days. You can either wait or I'll push my work (new tree integration in wysiwyg) in 6.4.1  
10:26 <vmassol> mflorea: ok I'll start as soon as the tests are fixed  
10:26 <mflorea> ok  
10:26 <vmassol> guys who can help on fixig the functional tests?  
10:27 <vmassol> plenty of extension tests failing  
10:27 <vmassol> who's worked on extensions recently ? :)  
10:27 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-extension/ for example, 6 tests failing  
10:27 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-extension/lastBuild/testReport/  
10:28 <gsmeria> has left #xwiki  
10:28 <gdelhumeau> Denis: I have renamed the issue  
10:28 <gdelhumeau> Denis: the component of the issue was "Flamingo Theme", but I agree it could have been more clear  
10:28 <gdelhumeau> (that's why I've renamed it)  
10:29 <Denis> thanks, the fact is the I check issue suggested, no time to do more most of the time  
10:29 <vmassol> tmortagne: this issue http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-extension/lastBuild/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-extension/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui.extension/ExtensionTest/testInstall/ seems to be caused by the failing assert: assertTrue(logSize > 1);  
10:29 <vmassol> so it seems we're expecting some logs and they're not there  
10:29 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
10:29 <vmassol> in the progress tab I see 2 lines, are these considered "logs"?  
10:29 <Denis> this is why having good description is important, since the suggestion are only based on issue description  
10:29 <vmassol> (on the screenshot at http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-extension/lastBuild/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-extension/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui.extension/ExtensionTest/testInstall/ )  
10:30 <gsmeria> has quit  
10:30 <tmortagne> vmassol: mflorea looked at it and there is some weird behavior he could not understand exactly  
10:30 <vmassol> seems we're looking for the text "starting job…" so it's not there indeed  
10:31 <mflorea> vmassol: that is the install plan, not the log. The log is missing because the Continue button was not clicked.  
10:31 <mflorea> in other words, the click on the Continue button had no effect  
10:31 <mflorea> for some reason  
10:32 <vmassol> so what do we do about it? who looks into it?  
10:33 <vmassol> the problem is the same for the 6 failing tests?  
10:33 <vmassol> seems so  
10:33 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
10:33 <vmassol> hmm maybe not  
10:34 <vmassol> expected:<[]installed> but was:<[remote-]installed>  
10:34 <vmassol> that looks different  
10:37 <tmortagne> proposal sent, please answer  
10:37 <mflorea> same, the button was not clicked. But that is not the only issue. Other tests may fail because after you click on Install (or other action) the extension cannot be found anymore..  
10:38 <vmassol> if the continue button was not clicked (not there for ex) we would have an error before no?  
10:38 <vmassol> so it means it's clicked probably  
10:38 <mflorea> the button is there  
10:38 <vmassol> but we're missing some wait maybe for the next content ot show up?  
10:38 <mflorea> but the click has no effect  
10:38 <vmassol> \*to  
10:39 <mflorea> there is a wait  
10:39 <vmassol> I don't see any reason other than the wait is not working  
10:39 <vmassol> do you?  
10:41 <mflorea> yes, the button may be moved up/down while the page is loaded or the extension display is updated and this confuses selenium. When using native events, Selenium computes the position of the button and then fires a native click event at that position. If the button moves in the mean time then the click has no effect.  
10:41 <mflorea> Selenium tries to simulate as much as possible the user behaviour. The same can happen for the user if we move the button right when she wants to click on it  
10:42 <mflorea> another reason could be that the button is disabled, although the tests waits for the button to become enabled  
10:43 <vmassol> maybe we're not doing the findElement just before the click and we're doing it too early and if it changes position we'd need a new findElement  
10:44 <vmassol> so selenium will succeed to click even if the button has been moved?  
10:45 <mflorea> maybe. there are a few findElementWithoutWait used in the PO

12:36 <Enygma`> has quit  
12:36 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
12:46 <Enygma`> gdelhumeau: I notice that XWiki.XWikiPreferences is in 2 locations now  
12:46 <Enygma`> xwiki-enterprise-ui-admin-user that is used in the main wiki  
12:46 <Enygma`> and xwiki-enterprise-ui-wiki that is used in subwikis  
12:47 <Enygma`> why was this done?  
12:47 <Enygma`> to be able to specify rights in the main wiki for the admin group?  
12:48 <Enygma`> if that is the only reason, shouldn`t we have used a transformation at build time and add those rights instead of forking XWikiPreferences?  
12:49 <Enygma`> so having XWikiPreferences in enterprise-ui-common and on enterprise-ui-mainwiki just have that transformation to end up with a modified document in the xar  
13:23 <gdelhumeau> Hi Enygma`  
13:23 <gdelhumeau> A transformation during the build would be better indeed  
13:24 <gdelhumeau> By the time I did this, I did not know the transformation plugin  
13:24 <gdelhumeau> it would be really better  
13:35 <Enygma`> yes, since the user module has nothing to do with preferences and if you want to extend/transform XWikiPreferences you are forced to depend on user, which might not be nice  
14:00 <Enygma`> gdelhumeau: created http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XE-1461

15:59 <cjd> vmassol1: did you checkout automatic SASL auth ?  it's pretty nice  
16:00 <cjd> it's something with ssl where it sends the auth while doing the ssl handshake  
16:00 <cjd> but it means you don't need to do /msg chanserv identify whateverpassword

22:06 <lucaa> has quit  
22:26 <kyndel> has joined #xwiki  
22:27 <kyndel> Hello!  
22:28 <kyndel> I am trying to install xWiki on my webhost (iPage) and I'm not sure if it is even possible.  If it is possible I need help doing so.  If it isn't, I want to know about possible ways to get xwiki installed on a server.  
22:36 <sburjan> kyndel: Hello. First of all, XWiki needs at least Java 7 to run, so any server which has Java installed should do the trick  
22:37 <sburjan> here is a guide on how to install it: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Installation  
22:37 <kyndel> sburjan: how can i tell if my server has java installed? i've viewed that guide, thanks.  
22:37 <sburjan> are you running on a windows or linux system ?  
22:38 <kyndel> it's a webhost  
22:38 <kyndel> i don't know what their server is based on  
22:38 <sburjan> then you should see which services you have available from your host  
22:39 <kyndel> What should I ask them specifically? if they have java installed?  
22:40 <sburjan> Well I think this depends on the service you bought from them. Which you know better than I do. You should see what is included.  
22:41 <sburjan> what plan do you have ? Essential, Wordpress, VPS or Dedicated ?  
22:45 <kyndel> They just told me I need the VPS plan to run Tomcat  
22:45 <sburjan> seems so, yes  
22:46 <kyndel> $20 a month, not a viable option for me  
22:47 <sburjan> yes, usually java is more expensive than PHP hosting  
22:47 <kyndel> Why is that?  
22:47 <sburjan> well because php is much more lightwight than java regarding resources, especially RAM  
22:49 <kyndel> i see  
22:49 <kyndel> i might just have to go with a wiki that runs on PHP then..  
22:50 <sburjan> you can ask for a wiki from the xwiki.org if that's okay with you. I don't know exactly the terms and conditions  
22:50 <sburjan> you could have an xwiki instance like kyndel.myxwiki.org  
22:50 <kyndel> do you know if it's possible to have secured pages with that service?  
22:50 <sburjan> please check http://myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome  
22:51 <sburjan> what do you mean by secured ?  
22:51 <kyndel> i mean to set permission for viewing a particular page that require users to be logged in to their account  
22:51 <sburjan> of course, yes. It's secured  
22:51 <kyndel> how long would it take to get set up on that service?  
22:52 <sburjan> follow the instructions on the link I gave you and send an e-amil to the userslist  
22:52 <sburjan> shouldn't take too long, depending on the availability of the devs. around 2-3 days  
22:53 <kyndel> ok i'll check it out. thank you  
22:53 <sburjan> yw  
22:54 <lyes> has joined #xwiki
